doc.abstracts: On November 24, 1991, Nicholas C. Hope, James Q. Harrison, and Ali Sebati participated in a joint interview session conducted by the Brookings Institution on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis, Richard Webb, and Devesh Kapur. The transcript mainly concerns the Bank's relationship with Indonesia. During Mr. Hope's tenure at the Bank from 1977 to 2000, he worked in the following areas: as an economist for the policy and budget office (1977-1979); as an economist on the World Development Report for the development policy staff (1979-1980); as a division chief for the external debt division of the economic analysis and projections department (1980-1986); as a division chief for the industrial development and finance division of the projects department for East Asia and Pacific region (1986-1987); as a division chief for the industry and energy operations division of country department V, Asia region (1987-1990); as a resident representative in Indonesia (1990-1993); as director of the country department II, China, Mongolia, and East Asia and Pacific region (1994-1997); as director of the transition staff for the office of the Vice President in the Europe and Central Asia region (1997-1998); and as director of the staff exchange program (1998-2000). During Mr. Harrison’s tenure at the Bank from 1972 to 2000, he worked in the following areas: in the Young Professionals Program (1972-1973); as an economist for the loan office in the program department of South Asia (1973-1975); as an economist and senior economist for his resident mission in India (1975-1980); as a senior economist, division B, India, country programs department of South Asia (1980-1984); as a senior economist of the office of the director for the country programs department 1, Europe and Middle East and North Africa (1984-1987); as lead economist for the country operations department 4, Europe and Middle East and North Africa (1987-1988); as a lead economist of the office of the director for the country operations department 4, Europe and Middle East and North Africa (1988-1989); as a lead economist of the economic unit for country department 5, Asia (1989-1991); as a lead economist for country department 3, East Asia and Pacific (1991-1993); as a chief of the human relations division for country department 4, Europe and Central Asia (1993-1995); as a chief of the county operations division 1 for the country department 4, Europe and Central Asia (1995-1997); as a lead economist for the poverty reduction and economic management sector unit in Europe and Central Asia (1997-1998); and as a sector leader for the education sector unit in South Asia (1998-2000). During Mr. Sabeti's tenure at the Bank from 1973 to 1996, he worked in the following areas: as a railway engineer for the projects department in Latin America and Caribbean (1973-1974); as a senior railway specialist (1975-1981) and as a deputy chief (1981-1984) for the transportation division of the projects department in South Asia; as chief of the transportation division for the projects department in East Asia and Pacific (1984-1987); as chief of the infrastructure division for the technical department in Asia (1987-1990); as chief of the operations unit, country department 5 in Asia (1990-1991); as chief of the operations unit, country department 3 in East Asia and Pacific (1991-1993); as chief of the telecommunications and informatics division for the industry and energy department of the finance and private sector development (1993-1994); and as adviser to the office of the director of the industry and energy department for finance and private sector development (1994-1996).
